title: 109_s755
content: The "Informed Choice Act" may be cited as the short title. Grants are provided for the purchase of ultrasound equipment. The Secretary of Health and Human Services may grant funds for ultrasound equipment to nonprofit organizations providing free ultrasound examinations to pregnant women under medical supervision. Eligibility requires tax-exempt status, operating as a pregnancy help clinic, and offering medical services supervised by a physician. The entity must be under the supervision of a licensed physician and comply with all legal requirements to provide medical services to pregnant women. Each pregnant woman must be shown the ultrasound image of the fetus and given a description of its characteristics. Each pregnant woman must be given the approximate age of the embryo or fetus based on medical judgment. They should also receive information on abortion alternatives, such as childbirth and adoption, along with resources for assistance. The entity applying for a grant must have medical malpractice insurance of at least $1,000,000 to cover activities related to the ultrasound machine. The grant amount cannot exceed 50% of the ultrasound machine's purchase price or $20,000, whichever is less. The entity should not receive more than 30% of its revenue from a single source or donor. Grants require an application submitted to the Secretary in the specified form and manner. The application for a grant must meet specific requirements determined by the Secretary. The applicant must agree to report annually on compliance with eligibility conditions. A "community based pregnancy help medical clinic" provides free medical services to pregnant women under a licensed physician's supervision without charging for services rendered. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. $3,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 2006, with additional funding for fiscal years 2007 through 2009 for the implementation of this section.
